intro: Jacobaea leucophylla, commonly known as the white-leaf ragwort, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, silvery-green leaves and produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Jacobaea leucophylla is also noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
